lines.text: It begins with the king as a boy, having to spend the night alone in the forest to prove his courage so he can become king. Now while he is spending the night alone he's visited by a sacred vision. Out of the fire appears the holy grail, symbol of God's divine grace. And a voice said to the boy, "You shall be keeper of the grail so that it may heal the hearts of men." But the boy was blinded by greater visions of a life filled with power and glory and beauty. And in this state of radical amazement he felt for a brief moment not like a boy, but invincible, like God, so he reached into the fire to take the grail, and the grail vanished, leaving him with his hand in the fire to be terribly wounded. Now as this boy grew older, his wound grew deeper. Until one day, life for him lost its reason. He had no faith in any man, not even himself. He couldn't love or feel loved. He was sick with experience. He began to die. One day a fool wandered into the castle and found the king alone. And being a fool, he was simple minded, he didn't see a king. He only saw a man alone and in pain. And he asked the king, "What ails you friend?" The king replied, "I'm thirsty. I need some water to cool my throat". So the fool took a cup from beside his bed, filled it with water and handed it to the king. As the king began to drink, he realized his wound was healed. He looked in his hands and there was the holy grail, that which he sought all of his life. And he turned to the fool and said with amazement, "How can you find that which my brightest and bravest could not?" And the fool replied, "I don't know. I only knew that you were thirsty."
It's important to think. It's what separates us from lentils.
Respect for all kinds of life, a nice bowel movement on a regular basis, and a navy blazer.

I don't believe that God made man in his image. 'Cause most of the shit that happens comes from man. No, I think man was made in the Devil's image. And women were created out of God. 'Cause after all, women can have babies, which is kind of like creating. And which also accounts for the fact that women are so attracted to men... 'cause let's face it... the Devil is a hell of a lot more interesting! Believe me, I've slept with some saints in my day, I know what I'm talking about. So the whole point in life is for men and women to get married... so that God and the Devil can get together and work it out. Not that we have to get married. God forbid.
I don't mean to be flippant or to enrage you or anything, but you're a psychotic man.
I know.
A very nice psychotic man.
Thank you.
What do you think of the death penalty?
Death is definitely a penalty! It ain't no fuckin' gift!

people who are destined for greatness like Walt Disney... and Hitler. Then there's the rest of us, he called us "the bungled and the botched." We get teased. We sometimes get close to greatness, but we never get there. We're the expendable masses. We get pushed in front of trains, take poison aspirin... get gunned down in Dairy Queens.
I can't believe I'm on a first name basis with these people!
Where would King Arthur be without Guinevere?
Happily married, probably.
Well, that's a bad... that's a bad example.
I'm talking to the little people!
Are they here?
They're saying, "Jack, go to the liquor store and findeth the Jack of Daniels so that ye may be shitfaced, doo-lang, doo-LANG!"
Are they really saying that?

[shouts]
You're out of your fucking mind!

[happily]
Bingo!
Didja hear that Jimmy Nickles got picked up yesterday?
Oh, yeah?
Yeah. He got caught pissin' on a bookstore. Man is a *pig*. No excuse for that.
[lady drops coins in his cup]
Thank you, baby. It's social anarchy when people start pissing on bookstores.
[man throws coins on the ground near his feet, which Disabled Veteran cannot reach]
Asshole. He didn't even look at you.

He's payin' so he don't have to look. See... guy goes to work every day, eight hours a day, seven days a week. Gets his nuts so tight in a vice that he starts questioning the very fabric of his existence. Then one day, 'bout quitting time, Boss calls him into the office and says, "Hey Bob, whyncha come on in here and kiss my ass for me, will you?" Well, he says, "Hell with it. I don't care what happens, I just want to see the expression on his face as I jab this pair of scissors into his arm."
[sighs]

Then he thinks of me. He says, "Waitaminit. I got both my arms, I got both my legs. At least I'm not begging for a living. Sure enough, Bob's gonna put those scissors down and pucker right up. See, I'm what you call kind of a "moral traffic light", really. I'm like sayin', "Red! Go no further! Boooo-ee boooo-ee boooo-ee..."
Did you lose your mind all at once, or was it a slow, gradual process?

What I'm in the mood for is sort of a Katherine-Hepburny, Cary-Granty kinda thing. Nothing heavy; I couldn't take heavy. Something zany! I'm looking for something zany... or something modern would be fine, too, like a Goldy-Hawny, Chevy-Chasey kinda thing - you know, funny! I want to laugh. I have to laugh tonight, really. Oh, do you have anything with that comedian, he's on that show that's on the radio? You know, the guy who says, "Hey, forgive me!" I get such a kick out of the way he says that! He's so goddamn adorable! That would be perfect! Didn't he make a movie?

[Jack tosses her a videotape]
"Ordinary Peepholes."
S'a big-titty, spread-cheeky kinda thing.
You have a great set of... dishes.
Jack, he's trying to start a con-vuh-sation...
Then talk to him, he won't bite you.
I have never been through a dating period.
It's a disgusting process. You haven't missed a thing.
Jack, I may be going out on a limb here, but you don't seem like a happy camper.
I'm a knight on a special quest. And I need help.
[Jack nods]
I wish there was some way I could just pay the fine and go home.

Hey! Edwin! Hey, c'mon now, I told you about these people, they only mate with their own kind, it's called yuppie inbreeding. That's why so many of them are retarded and wear the same clothes. They're not human, they don't feel love, they only negotiate *love moments*. They're evil, Edwin, they're repulsed by imperfection, horrified by the banal, everything that America stands for, everything that you and I fight for! They must be stopped before it's too late! It's us or them!

[quietly]
OK, Jack.
Jack Lucas - Found dead next to a dead, naked man. The two were dead. His companion was naked.
[Parry awakens from his catatonic state]
I was dreaming, Jack. I was dreaming that I was married to a beautiful woman... you were in it, too.
[pause]
I really miss her, Jack. Is it okay to miss her now?

[singing]
Holding my penis... what a wonderful way of saying how much you like me.
Didn't you say that what you liked about our relationship is that we didn't have to think? We could just be there for each other.
Suicidal paranoiacs'll say anything to get laid.
Come back, we'll rummage.
I'm Anne Morrow Lindbergh, Jack - I can't find my baby.
C'mon, Jack, what do you think the Crusades were? A Pope's publicity stunt?
Jack, love of my life, you hate people.
I'm surprised some man just doesn't come in here and snatch you up all for themselves.
*You're* surprised?
you can be a real bitch sometimes.

[Lydia begins to smile and starts laughing]
Really...?

[smiling]
Yeah!

[laughing]
Wow!
I know, I know - it feels great!

[to Parry]
Some billionaire's got the Holy Grail in his library on Fifth Avenue.

[upon Lydia's arrival for a manicure]
Can I getchoo something, l'il kawfee?
No.
L'il tea?
No.
L'il tequilaaaaah?

[Swinging on a rope]
Thank God nobody looks up in this town!
I've been dating longer than I've been driving!

[on himself, and Parry]
"Radio Personality Turns Screwball On Mission From God." I just hope that when they put me away, they find me a place right next to his.
[last lines]
Goodnight, Manhattan! Say goodnight, Jack.
Goodnight, Jack.
[laughs]
I have a hard-on for you the size of Florida!
I'm hearing horses! Parry will be so pleased!
No... but I *do* believe in fairies.

[Jack is drunk on Jack Daniel's]
Breakfast of champions, huh, Jack?
Have another one, Jack. It's on the house... just like everything else.
How much?
Well, you're a store member, so we could probably...

[firmly]
Forty bucks.
I was attacked, two kids tried to set me on fire.

[as Jack is waking up]
Hi, welcome back.
Have I died?
I am deeply smitten.
the bungled and the botched. People who get close to greatness then fall short. You be a good kid, my Italian friend, say no to drugs.

[on the radio]
I told you about these people. They're evil, Edwin. They must be stopped.
Mendacity!
Of all the people in this city, I can't believe I met the guy whose wife I killed.
Have another drink, Jack, it's on the house. Like everything else.

[Dumping her]
Well, I think, now I know more...
Firstly, you don't know shit, okay? Secondly, what have we been doing here but time? I love you. Do you love me? You're not even going to give me that are you?
We both got something out of this.
WHAT DID I GET? WHAT DID I GET that I couldn't have got any day of the week from a guy on the street with NO name?
You disappear, I'm worried sick! All I do is stay home and cook like a jerk!
[camera pulls back, she's alone]
He's a son of a bitch.
[starts crying]
Ever get the feeling you're being punished for your sins?
You can't be in here.
